Posted By: Arachnos (9/15/2012 5:51:40 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ Arachnos  
  
Then it's not strictly worse.   
  
A card that is strictly worse is one that is identical to another card, but is worse by just 1 aspect. For example, [Scathe Zombies](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scathe Zombies) is strictly worse than [Walking Corpse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Walking Corpse), because although they're both 2/2 Black Zombies, [Scathe Zombies](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scathe Zombies) costs ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) while [Walking Corpse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Walking Corpse) costs ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol).  
  
A common example of a "strictly better" argument is [Fugitive Wizard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fugitive Wizard) and [Memnite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnite). Sure, Fugitive Wizard costs ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) while [Memnite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnite) costs ![0](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=0&type=symbol), but what if you had [Azami, Lady of Scrolls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Azami, Lady of Scrolls) on the field? You'd then have a 1-cost [Archivist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Archivist) instead.   
What if you played [Mass Appeal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mass Appeal)? [Memnite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnite) wouldn't draw you that extra card. What if you played [Kessig Macontents](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kessig Macontents)? [Memnite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnite) wouldn't add 1 more damage to the spel... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
@ Arachnos

Then it's not strictly worse.

A card that is strictly worse is one that is identical to another card, but is worse by just 1 aspect. For example, Scathe Zombies is strictly worse than Walking Corpse, because although they're both 2/2 Black Zombies, Scathe Zombies costs while Walking Corpse costs .

A common example of a "strictly better" argument is Fugitive Wizard and Memnite. Sure, Fugitive Wizard costs while Memnite costs , but what if you had Azami, Lady of Scrolls on the field? You'd then have a 1-cost Archivist instead.
What if you played Mass Appeal? Memnite wouldn't draw you that extra card. What if you played Kessig Macontents? Memnite wouldn't add 1 more damage to the spel... (see all)

This is actually better than 0-cost artifacts for a number of reasons, the biggest one being Cloudstone Curio. Two kobolds and the curio make easy Storm fuel.
